description:
Witness the nation’s finest ice carvers as they compete for $9,000 in prizes during 3 rounds of breathtaking competition in Downtown Ithaca. The festival features impressive display sculptures, fire demonstrations, the ever-popular Ice Bar: an outdoor bar made entirely of ice, serving beer, wine, and hot cocoa, and a tasty Chowder Cook-off. Ithaca Ice Festival ice carving competition is a National Ice Carving Association sanctioned event. 

Day One (Thursday, Dec. 8):

Ice Bar Opens for the weekend! Visit the opening day of the outdoor Ice Bar. Bring the whole family and enjoy the winter weather with a glass of beer from Bacchus Brewing Company, wine from Six Mile Creek Vineyard or cocoa and coffee from Waffle Frolic while watching fire-fueled entertainment at this frosty extravaganza from 5-9pm.

Hot cocoa and other yummy warm beverages from Waffle Frolic! 

Evening Entertainment Schedule: 
6:30-7:15pm Nate the Great 
7:30- 8:30pm Cosmic Karma Fire Dance Performance


Day Two (Friday, Dec. 9): 5-9pm

Speed Carving Competition: The opening competition of Ice Festival!  Watch carvers test their speed and skill in this
one-block, speed-carve, single elimination competition.  Each participant will have approximately 20 minutes to create
a complete sculpture.

Ice Bar: will be open and serving delicious hot and cold beverages from 5-9pm!


Day Three (Saturday, Dec. 10): A full day of excitement for everyone!

Carve and Deliver Competition: 9am-12pm - Competing carvers must carve and deliver an ice sculpture to a downtown location in just three hours!
 
Ice Bar: Will be open 12-5pm for warm or  frosty beverages all day!

Mt. Pleasant Dog Sled Team - 2-4pm Come snap a photo with these pups! 

Ithaca Tuba Christmas (Bernie Milton Pavilion) 2-3pm 
The Mistletones (in Trolley Circle) 3:15-4pm 
 
Two-Block Showpiece Challenge: 2-6pm. This final round is the ultimate test of these carver's abilities!  Competitors will have just 4 hours to produce a dramatic and impressive sculpture using 2 large blocks of ice.  Carvers will not only compete with each other for points, but also with the elements, rain, extreme cold, or unseasonal heat.   In early December, one never knows what the weather will be, making the competition that much more exciting.  
 
7th Annual Downtown Ithaca Chowder Cook-Off Happening on the Commons and surrounding streets including Aurora, Cayuga and Dewitt Mall from 12-5pm,  Ice Festival goers can stay warm by sample over 20 different traditional, exotic, and gourmet chowders from local restaurants competing to be crowned our next Chowder Cup Champion!  Sampling tickets are for sale in advance and on the day-of downtown. 

Tickets for Chowder Cook-Off 
 10 Tickets for $10 
Advance Sale Tickets will be available December 5 at Noon the Downtown Ithaca Visitor Center (CASH ONLY).

Advance Credit Card Sales - DIA Office Only - Inside Center Ithaca (171 East State Street) 

If you are purchasing for a large group please call the DIA office in advance 607-277-8679. 

Tickets will also be available the day of Chowder Cook-Off at the Ticket Booth on the Commons.

Will Call Pickup on the day of the event will be located in the Downtown Ithaca Visitor Center.

Habitat for Humanity's Annual Cookie Walk is returning to Center Ithaca from 10am-2pm

Thank you to our 2016 Hospitality Sponsor Hilton Garden Inn Ithaca!

This program was made possible, in part, by a grant from the Tompkins County Tourism Program.

description:
The 2016 Summer Concert Series presented by CFCU Community Credit Union kicks off on the Bernie Milton Pavilion stage in the Ithaca Commons on Thursday, June 23! The Summer Concert Series is a free outdoor concert series open to the public held every Thursday evening from June 23 - September 15 (with the exception of Grassroots week- the show will be on Wednesday, July 20 not Thursday). Local and national acts perform music in genres including jazz, blues, reggae, folk, hip hop, country, bluegrass, rock, and more! 

Enjoy a beer and wine garden open for the duration of each concert. Seating is not provided but participants are encouraged to bring a chair and stay a while! The Downtown Ithaca Summer Concert Series has become a weekly summer tradition in the local community; Ithacans and tourists alike enjoy happening upon a vibrant downtown on a weekday evening. 


The CFCU Community Credit Union (CFCU) returns as title sponsor of the award-winning CFCU Summer Concert Series and will be continuing their support of the United Way of Tompkins County through a fundraiser with exciting prizes. Concertgoers can buy a reusable cup, with 100 percent of the proceeds going to the United Way, and be entered to win a private performance by the Gunpoets and other cool perks. This year, the series is also supported by Seneca Beverage Corporation, Ithaca Marriott Downtown on the Commons, Green Street Pharmacy, Six Mile Creek Vineyard, GreenStar Natural Foods Market, The Ithaca Journal, Legacy Foundation of Tompkins County, and the J. M. McDonald Foundation. 
 
For more information about the CFCU Summer Concert Series and other summer events in downtown Ithaca, please visit www.downtownithaca.com.

description:
Sneak a peek in the window this Wednesday at 8pm in Collegetown's historic pub, Rulloff's.  Here you will find Anthony Cubbage a singer-songwriter pianist from Philadelphia, PA who experiments with the limits of popular music, infusing elements of jazz and folk into catchy melodies. 

People refer to his songs as "a mix between John Mayer and Ed Sheeran" with hints of Mumford-and-Son-like textures. His most recent music (to be released in April will include electronic and hip-hop elements)

The kitchen at Rulloff’s is open until 10pm during the show serving a wide selections of salads, burgers, fresh appetizers and tasty warm entrees to cure the springtime chill. 
The great selection of craft beers on draft will keep you near the tap and pleasantly surprised. #Rulloffs

****Admission is free and the people are friendly. 
Band: http://cubbagemusic.com/

For more music check out: https://www.facebook.com/rulloffs/events

description:
Refresh Your Routine: Sustainability & Wellness Pop-Up is a 2-day event that kicks off Downtown Employee Appreciation Week, gives a fresh outlook on the daily grind, and inspires you to add some goodness to your day. 

Activities for both days are located in Bank Alley (on the Commons) and are listed in more detail below:

DAY 1: MONDAY, JULY 25

10-6: Change up your office’s scenery! Donate used office furniture or shop new-to-you items from Ithaca ReUse Center. Grab a new summer read from Autumn Leaves Used Books and some tunes from Angry Mom Records while you're at it. 

12-3: Tunes provided by DJ Duce spinning classic vinyl records, one at a time!

12-1:30: Love coffee? Get free iced coffee from Press Cafe when you pick up your Downtown Employee Discount Card. (Need Discount Cards? Sign up your office here:  http://goo.gl/forms/c4QRH61ONwUsdWNk2)

12-2: Need career advice? Spin the prize wheel and gain knowledge from the experts at Tompkins Workforce New York! 

12:30-1:30: Come meet the trainers from Finger Lakes Fitness Center and get workplace health tips to keep you energized! 

12:30-1:30: Learn how to “up-level” your life through thankfulness at Michelle Courtney Berry’s Gratitude Hour! Michelle is a personal life and success coach, author, speaker, and educator with expertise in wellness and stress management. For more information on Michelle visit Courtney Consulting Enterprises, LLC or http://www.michelleberrycoach.com!

DAY 2: TUESDAY, JULY 26
 
10-6: Streamline your surroundings by donating used home and office items to the Ithaca ReUse Center (or buying new pieces!)

10-6: Downsize your closet by donating toiletry items and women’s professional clothing to the Women's Opportunity Center Donation Station!

12-2: Boost your career with Tompkins Workforce New York! Spin the prize wheel and receive advice on work-related topics from career experts.

DON'T FORGET! 
Click here to sign your office up for Downtown Employee Discount Cards: http://goo.gl/forms/c4QRH61ONwUsdWNk2

description:
Downtown Ithaca is Encouraging Shopping Local on Saturday, November 26th and throughout the Holiday Season. 

WHY SHOP LOCAL? Small Business Saturday was started by American Express four years ago so that small business could have its day. Big retailers have Black Friday and online retailers have Cyber Monday, so Small Business Saturday is a way to educate consumers about shopping locally and to have an impact on the small business bottom line, kick starting the holiday season. (from Shopsmall.com)

Downtown Ithaca has over 100 independent, locally owned stores and businesses to choose from. By shopping or dining locally on Saturday, November 26th and for the holidays, patrons can show their support for local businesses and for our community.
When money is spent at independent locally owned business the money stays here. Local businesses donate more, and the owners and managers live and pay taxes here, strengthening the economic base of where we live. Plus the one-of-a-kind businesses contribute to the character of our community with unique shopping and dining options.

#SHOPSMALL SELFIE CONTEST TO WIN $100 DOWNTOWN ITHACA GIFT CARD

When you shop on Small Business Saturday snap a selfie and use the hasgtags #shopsmall and #downtownithaca on Facebook or Instagram(selfie must include both hashtags to be considered). 

The winner will receive a $100 Downtown Ithaca gift card, which can be used at over 100 shops and restaurants downtown and the winning photo will be reposted onto Downtown Ithaca social media pages. 

For more information visit shopsmall.com, contact the DIA at 607-277-8679, or email us at info@downtownithaca.com

description:
On Friday, September 5, 2014, the Downtown Ithaca Alliance will be hosting a Welcome Back Students Party from 6-9pm.  Sim Redmond Band will be performing on State Street under the State Theater Marquee outdoors with opener Jill McCracken and the Last Hoorah. The show is FREE and open to the public.  Here you can find a selection of local beer and wine compliments of Seneca Beverage Corporation, visit local businesses, and get more information on the unique services that are blossoming at Ithaca To Go.   Kick off the school year right with this fun evening of music and dance in the heart of the City.

The Welcome Back Students Party will also be the release of our new Student Discount Card.  This new program offers students deals and discounts throughout the school year at numerous stores and restaurants downtown.  All students of Cornell University, Ithaca College, Wells College, Tompkins Cortland Community College, and the Finger Lakes School of Massage are eligible to receive these free discount cards.  Discounts available on clothing, food, gifts, and more!

Our Welcome Back Students Party is sponsored by Ithaca To Go.  “Ithaca to Go!” coordinates catering and food delivery through online ordering from over 30 restaurants in the Ithaca area.  Order your favorite food online at ithacatogo.com or with their mobile app!  

Sponsors: M&T Bank, Ithaca to Go! & Seneca Beverage Corporation

For more information regarding the Welcome Back Students Concert and/or the Student Discount Cards visit www.downtownithaca.com/studentdiscounts or contact the Downtown Ithaca Alliance via email at info@downtownithaca.com or call the Downtown Ithaca Alliance office at 607-277-8679.

The official event page for Ithaca's premier event of the Fall, Apple Harvest Festival presented by the Tompkins Trust Company.  A three day celebration of food, fun, and apples!

Three fun-filled days of apples, local produce, fresh baked goods, family entertainment, games, prizes and live performances on two stages. Apple Harvest Festival is a great introduction to the farms and artists in Ithaca and its surrounding farming communities  

First time visitors can witness a variety of wonderful local entertainment while strolling Ithaca's recently remodeled outdoor pedestrian shopping mall, The Ithaca Commons.  The pedestrian mall is the epicenter of the festival and the gateway to a nostalgic journey of harvest season fun.

Over 100 vendors will be selling unique apple varieties, hot apple cider donuts, kettle corn, local farm fresh baked goods and a multitude of around the world specialties. Local farmers are on site selling everything from tasty apple beverages to local pumpkins and of course, apples, apples and more apples. Wineries and cideries have regional beverages available for tasting and purchase.  Kids can visit with the goats and learn how fiber is made with Laughing Goat Fiber Farm.  Looking for quality goods, visit 50 different handcrafting artisans along Cayuga Street at the fall craft show which includes jewelry, ceramics, home decor, body care, specialty gifts, unique sculpture, clothing and so much more.
__  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  __  
The Tompkins Trust Company FAMILY FUN ZONE will be located in the Center Ithaca Lobby Fri-Sun These will be free crafts and games available while supplies last each day.

description:
The Ithaca Asian American Association, the Downtown Ithaca Alliance and the Finger Lakes Wine Center are hosting an evening of Asian cuisine and wine pairings at the Finger Lakes Wine Center, 237 South Cayuga St.

The evening of celebration will have 10 separate dishes each paired beautifully with a tasting of Finger Lakes wines by well known sommelier, David Sparrow. Contributing restaurants include: Hai Hong Restaurant, Peking Restaurant, Saigon Kitchen, Taste of Thai Express and Vietnam Restaurant.

Courses include Crispy Duck with Plum Sauce and White Rice, Vietnamese (vegetable) Spring Rolls, Peking Shrimp, Grilled Flank Steak Vermicelli, and a fried banana dessert, just to name a few!

Tickets are $25+ tax per person  and can be purchased in advance by calling the Finger Lakes Wine Center (607) 882-9663 or the Downtown Ithaca Alliance (607) 277-8679.

description:
Crystal Garden comes to The Range in Ithaca on April 2, 2017, featuring band founder and Dave Matthews Band violinist, Boyd Tinsley and Mycle Wastman of TV's The Voice. Tickets are very limited and will sellout. Each ticket includes a meet and greet with Crystal  Garden including Boyd Tinsley! Don't miss this rare intimate performance with this up and coming band. Opening the show will be Vinegar Williams      

Crystal Garden is the brainchild of Boyd Tinsley of Dave Matthews Band. For two years he sought out the right group of musicians to form a modern day rock band. The four members of the band are from Seattle, San Francisco, and Toronto. Crystal Garden will soon release a CD that features Boyd Tinsley and special guest Stanley Jordan. 

The band members are Mycle Wastman, vocals, Charlie Csontos, bass, Matt Frewen, drums, 

 "Vinegar Williams is the solo project of Singer/Songwriter Chris Everson, current frontman for the Ithaca grunge rock band, Decoration Day, and formerly of Armed Uprising, CustomDriver, and 30 Watts Short."

description:
ATTENTION OLYMPIANS:

The time has come to claim your workplace glory in the annual Office Worker Olympic Games, part of Downtown Employee Appreciation Week! (*Not actually exclusive to office workers!!)

Start training now for the Staple Pull, Paper Wad Toss, Rubber Band Archery, Water Cooler Relay, and the dreaded Late for Work Sprint! 

Sign up your team of 4 at http://bit.ly/29EaPTm to compete and test your speed, agility, dedication, precision, poise, and other less useful skills. 

Want to bring home the gold but don’t have enough Olympians? Teams of 4 are encouraged but not required.  As long as your office has at least one Iron Olympian ready to lay it all on the line and participate in every event your office can be represented. 

Bragging rights and pride aren’t the only thing on the line--prizes will be awarded to the TOP TWO overall teams!

The games are free to participate. Teams may leave upon completing the events and do not need to stay for the duration of the games. 

Do you have what it takes to bring home the gold?

REGISTER NOW at http://bit.ly/29EaPTm

Kitestring is a versatile acoustic band from upstate New York that plays original music with influences from 90’s Alternative, Americana, and Soul with Josh Ross (Guitar/Vocals), Corbin Miller (Upright Bass/Vocals) and Marty Farchione (Guitar). Equally well-suited to provide intimate stripped down rock music or fill a room with danceable tunes and full harmonies. The songwriting explores the normal and sometimes mundane aspects of life and relationships and finds magic in the small moments.

description:
ITHACA ICE FESTIVAL(Free to the public): 
Witness the nation’s finest ice carvers as they compete for $9,000 in prizes during 3 rounds of breathtaking competition in Downtown Ithaca. Ice Festival features impressive display sculptures, fire demonstrations, the ever-popular Ice Bar: an outdoor bar made entirely of ice, serving beer, wine, and hot cocoa, and a of course Chowder Cook-off! Ithaca Ice Festival ice carving competition is a National Ice Carving Association sanctioned event. 
___________________________________________________
THURSDAY, DEC. 10 - Ice Fest Day 1
5-9PM Join us for the opening of Ice Fest with an evening at the Ice Bar. Bring the whole family and enjoy the winter weather with a glass of beer, wine or cocoa while watching fire-fueled entertainment at this frosty extravaganza. 
6PM - Join Mayor Svante Myrick for a celebratory toast at the Ice Bar to kick off the new holiday lights on the Commons – a gift to the Ithaca community made possible by CFCU Community Credit Union
Check out the fire-fueled performances too:
6:30PM - Nate the Great
7:30PM - Local Fire Dancers Becki Hawley & Amanda McLaughlin 
___________________________________________________
FRIDAY, DEC 11 - Ice Fest Day 2
5-9PM - Speed Carving Competition. This first competition is a one-block speed-carve single elimination where each participant will have 20 minutes to create a complete sculpture.
5-9 Ice Bar
6:00pm & 6:30pm- The Next Jennaration dancers
Bool's Flower Shop Open House - 5-8pm (209 N Aurora St)
__________________________________________________
SATURDAY, DEC. 12 - Ice Fest Day 3, Chowder Cook-Off & More! 
ICE FEST SCHEDULE (Free event)
9AM - 12PM - Carve & Deliver Competition: participants must carveand deliver an ice sculpture to a downtown location in just three hours.
12-5pm ICE BAR will be open! 
2 - 6PM - Two-Block Showpiece Challenge: This is the final round and promises to produce striking large pieces 

CHOWDER COOK-OFF (Ticketed Event) 
12 - 5PM - The 6th Annual Chowder Cook-off: Watch the competition while you taste over 20 chowders! The Ice Bar opens at Noon!
TICKET INFO: 
Advance Sale Tickets for Chowder Cook-Off are available at the Downtown Ithaca Visitor Center (CASH ONLY) now through end of day Friday. Beat the lines on Satruday and pick up tickets early.  Large group orders call: 607-277-8679. 

Tickets will also be available at the Chowder Cook-off ticket booth on Saturday.

MORE GREAT ACTIVITIES AROUND DOWNTOWN:
10AM - 2PM - Habitat for Humanity Annual Cookie Walk inside Center Ithaca. Buy the pound, 80+ varieties to choose from! https://www.facebook.com/events/1656437791243436/

10-6:30 - FREE chocolate samples at Life's So Sweet Chocolates and artistic snowglobe display. Located in Press Bay Alley
12-3PM - Holiday Cookie Exchange at Norabloom Botanicals & Beauty Lounge  - Bring 3 doz & an ingredient list (1 doz. to share & 2 doz to trade) More info at: https://www.facebook.com/events/907121942702392/ 
___________________________________________________
The Downtown Ithaca Alliance would like to thank the Hilton Garden Inn for their continued support of Ithaca Ice Festival.

description:
Please join us for…

The 29th Annual Downtown Ithaca Apple Harvest Festival – September 30 - October 2, 2011. 

The Festival is a weekend celebration of food, fun and the fall. The three-day Apple Harvest Festival attracts an audience of around 30,000 people to Downtown Ithaca and will take place from September 30 - October 2. The event has farmers, wineries, bakeries, crafters, food vendors, an apple pie eating competition, apples, apples and more apples. Activities include music, dancing, eating, education, amusement rides, Iron Chef event, craft-fair and street performers.

description:
An evening of singer songwriters with special guest Frank Critelli, from Connecticut. Frank will be joined by Janet Batch, Vee Da Bee, and Adrien Brodeur - showcasing a stunning diversity of our local talent. 

Frank Critelli writes songs. He dabbles in haiku and other short poetry. Sometimes he writes other stuff too. Like postcards. His songs are available on compact disc and for download at places like CD Baby. 

Frank Critelli often performs live. Sometimes he performs solo, and sometimes he is accompanied by one or more musical co-conspirators. Over the years he's played in streets and subways, clubs and coffeehouses, barrooms and classrooms, colleges, festivals, theaters, and (most recently) in his kitchen.

Frank Critelli enjoys local music scenes and the beer that goes with them, and co-hosts The Local Bands Show on 99.1fm WPLR-New Haven, and The Beer Show on CygnusRadio.com

https://www.facebook.com/Frank-Critelli-59852521448

8pm, $5

description:
Downtown Employee Appreciation Week
July 25th – 29th , 2011
Schedule of Events
Sign up by emailing matt@downtownithaca.com 
Visit the tent all week near Bernie Milton Pavilion (Center of the Ithaca Commons) or Tuesday at the Farmer’s Market to get free items, enter giveaways and competitions, or for more information. 

Monday, July 25th  - Bernie Milton Pavilion on the Commons 12-1:30p
Coffee Break! Free Hot Coffee or Iced Coffee*, Live Music
Downtown Employee Registration and Lanyard Pickup 

Tuesday, July 26th  - Dewitt Park 12-2p
Free Watermelon, Lemonade & lawn games at the Farmers Market

Wednesday, July 27th - Bernie Milton Pavilion on the Commons 12-1:30p
Launch of the Downtown Employee Discount Card Program (Discounts with Card Valid for 2011 and 2012)
Free Ice Cream provide by Way 2 Go*
Music in the Bernie Milton Pavilion 12-1:30p
Hot Dog Eating Competition – Send your best Hotdog Eater to eat Lou’s Famous Hot Dogs

Thursday, July 28th  - Bank Alley & Bernie Milton Pavilion on the Commons 12-1:30p
Office Worker Olympics* – Teams of four compete for the titles in tasks such as Paper Clip Chain Making, Trashcan Paper Toss and Parking Meter Dash. Compete between 12 and 1:30pm in Bank Alley. Each member of the team must compete in all events sometime between 12 and 1:30pm (all members do not have to be present at one time to allow for office coverage). Scores will be tallied and winners announced on Friday.                                                               
*Registration for the Olympics will take place day of beginning at Noon at the Employee Appreciation Tent on the Commons.
Free Popcorn
Summer Concert Series: the Horseflies 6-8pm in the Bernie Milton. 

Friday, July 29th  - Bernie Milton Pavilion on the Commons 12-1:30p
Casual Friday! Business on Top, Party on the Bottom Fashion Show – Wear your business attire on the top half and your party attire on the bottom and be seen by our Downtown photographer to win. Prizes will be awarded to the most Fashion Forward Downtown Worker.
Bring your kids to lunch for a day of fun on the Commons.  Games, balloons, face painting and more. 
Free Ice Cream Sundaes provided by Way 2 Go* Performance in the Bernie Milton Pavilion -  12-1:30p
Awards Announced for Office Olympics and Gnome Hunt 

After Work Restaurant Specials - All Week
Restaurants and Bars will be offering specials for Downtown Employees. Check our website for the schedule. 

The Great Downtown Gnome Hunt Starts Monday
The Downtown Gnome is sneaky but will give you a hint at 9am each morning as to where he is. Be the first to find the Gnome each day and win a Java Box and a Dozen Bagels from Collegetown Bagels. Hints on Twitter (Follow Downtown Ithaca), Facebook (“Like” Downtown Ithaca) & on DowntownIthaca.com. More information at downtownithaca.com.
*while supplies last

For more information visit DowntownIthaca.com or call Matt at 607-277-8679, email matt@downtownithaca.com

description:
The Bite of Ithaca is back for its 2nd year in Tompkins County! This five-day celebration of food exploration is taking place June 27 - July 1, 2016. 

Create your own culinary adventure by visiting participating restaurants to try various $5 "bites" including appetizers, tapas, desserts, drinks, and petite versions of popular menu items. 

Grab your coworkers for an out-of-the-box lunch or meet your friends for a unique dinner experience all across town!

Participating Restaurants include:

description:
The 14th Annual Great Downtown Ithaca Chili Cook-off will feature chili prepared by almost 40 restaurants (listed below) as they compete for the titles of Best Meat/Overall Chili, Best Vegetarian, and People's Choice Chili. 

In addition to Chili, there are other Chili related food items. The Chili Cook-off will feature a farmers market with vendors and local wineries, breweries, and farmer's sampling their goods. All activities will take place in downtown on The Commons and surrounding streets.

There will be other events occurring throughout the day of the cook-off including:
Chili 'stache Competition (3pm), Festive Photo Booth, and Street Performers

Live Entertainment Including:
Chili Eating Competition, Hot Pepper Show Down, DJ, and Chili Idol Karaoke.

For Tickets:
Pre Sale Tickets are on sale Now! 
VIP Packages- 
    -10 VIP tickets for $20 or 22 VIP tickets for $40 & Sassy Chili Necklace (while supplies last)
Sale Locations:Autumn Leaves Used Book Store, Collegetown Bagels (Collegetown and Downtown), the DIA office located in Center Ithaca at 171 E. State St.
    ***** The additional cost associated with the VIP ticket allows the patron access to a separate fast moving VIP line. In order to avoid waiting in long lines to purchase tickets, the DIA encourages attendees to purchase their tickets in advance. (VIP and Non-VIP tickets)

Non-VIP tickets cost: $5 for 5 or $10 for 11 for sampling chili, wine, beer or cider. 
There will be three ticket booths located at each entrance to the Commons (Aurora, Cayuga, and Bank Alley).

For more information visit: http://www.downtownithaca.com or call the DIA office at 607-277-8679

description:
Downtown Employee Appreciation Week is a 5-day celebration of all of the exceptional employees that work downtown. It's a week filled with giveaways, sustainability & wellness pop-up, Zumba party, and Office Olympics. You won't want to miss it!! 

MONDAY July 25 - Refresh Your Routine: Sustainability & Wellness Pop-Up Day 1- Bank Alley (The Commons)
Kick off Downtown Employee Appreciation Week with a fresh outlook on the daily grind! Get rejuvenated with the following activities throughout the day:

10-6: Change up your office’s scenery! Donate used office furniture or shop new-to-you items from Ithaca ReUse Center. 

12-3: Tunes provided by DJ Duce spinning classic vinyl records, one at a time!

12-1:30: Love coffee? Get free iced coffee, hot coffee, or tea from Press Cafe when you pick up your Downtown Employee Discount Card. 

12-2: Need career advice? Spin the prize wheel and gain knowledge from the experts at Tompkins Workforce New York! 

12:30-1:30: Come meet the trainers from Finger Lakes Fitness Center and get workplace health tips to keep you energized! 

TUESDAY July 26 - Refresh Your Routine: Sustainability & Wellness Pop-Up Day 2 - Bank Alley (The Commons)
You revamped your outlook, and now it’s time to act on that inspiration. Join us to add some goodness to your day:
 
10-6: Streamline your surroundings by donating used home and office items to the Ithaca ReUse Center (or buying new pieces!)

10-6: Downsize your closet by donating toiletry items and women’s professional clothing to the Women's Opportunity Center Donation Station!

12-2: Boost your career with Tompkins Workforce New York! Spin the prize wheel and receive advice on work-related topics from career experts. 

WEDNESDAY July 27 8-10am - MORNING BOOST! - Press Bay Alley 
This is not your average hump day. Come by Press Bay Alley for a Morning Boost party where you can dance, have free breakfast from BiciCocina Bicycle Food Cart, enjoy coffee, and learn some new moves from Zumba Instructor Khristina Thelen! What better way is there to start the day? 

 DJ ha-MEEN - Ithaca, NY on the 1s and 2s! 

8:30-9am – Free Zumba! RSVP at http://bit.ly/29Q4GEy and get a free fresh juice from Concord's Maine Squeeze and a chance to win 3 free classes at Finger Lakes Fitness Center!! 

9-10am Learn how to “up-level” your life through thankfulness at Michelle Courtney Berry’s Gratitude Hour! Michelle is a personal life and success coach, author, speaker, and educator with expertise in wellness and stress management. For more information on Michelle visit Courtney Consulting Enterprises, LLC or http://www.michelleberrycoach.com/!

THURSDAY July 28 6-8pm - Treat yourself & Dance! - Bernie Milton Pavilion
Be sure to stop by later for CFCU Summer Concert Series-Wassa Pan Afrika Dance Ensemble and get $2 OFF beer and wine with your State ID and Downtown Pass! 

FRIDAY July 29 12-1:30pm - Annual Office Worker Olympics! - Press Bay Alley
Claim your workplace glory! Sign up your team of 4 now to compete in games that will test your speed, agility, dedication, precision, poise, and other less useful skills. Prizes (and bragging rights!) will be awarded to the top 2 overall teams!

Want to bring home the gold but don’t have enough Olympians? Teams of 4 are encouraged but not required. As long as your office has at least one Iron Olympian ready to participate in every event your office can be represented. 

Register for the Olympics at http://bit.ly/29EaPTm
DON'T FORGET! 
Click here to sign your office up for Downtown Employee Discount Cards: http://goo.gl/forms/c4QRH61ONwUsdWNk2

description:
The 2016 Summer Concert Series presented by CFCU Community Credit Union kicks off on the Bernie Milton Pavilion stage in the Ithaca Commons on Thursday, June 23! The Summer Concert Series is a free outdoor concert series open to the public held every Thursday evening from June 23 - September 15 (with the exception of Grassroots week- the show will be on Wednesday, July 20 not Thursday). Local and national acts perform music in genres including jazz, blues, reggae, folk, hip hop, country, bluegrass, rock, and more! 

Enjoy a beer and wine garden open for the duration of each concert. Seating is not provided but participants are encouraged to bring a chair and stay a while! The Downtown Ithaca Summer Concert Series has become a weekly summer tradition in the local community; Ithacans and tourists alike enjoy happening upon a vibrant downtown on a weekday evening. 


The CFCU Community Credit Union (CFCU) returns as title sponsor of the award-winning CFCU Summer Concert Series and will be continuing their support of the United Way of Tompkins County through a fundraiser with exciting prizes. Concertgoers can buy a reusable cup, with 100 percent of the proceeds going to the United Way, and be entered to win a private performance by the Gunpoets and other cool perks. This year, the series is also supported by Seneca Beverage Corporation, Ithaca Marriott Downtown on the Commons, Green Street Pharmacy, Six Mile Creek Vineyard, GreenStar Natural Foods Market, The Ithaca Journal, Legacy Foundation of Tompkins County, and the J. M. McDonald Foundation. 
 
For more information about the CFCU Summer Concert Series and other summer events in downtown Ithaca, please visit www.downtownithaca.com.
 
2016 CFCU Summer Concert Series Schedule 
Thursdays* 6-8pm
 
06/23    Stone Cold Miracle
06/30    Casey Max and The Dixie Kats
07/07    Caribe Jazz All Stars                
07/14    Kings of The Fall 
07/20*    (Wednesday Show) Ithaca Underground: Sammus with ¡ Viva Mayhem! (opening) 
07/28    Wassa Pan Afrika Dance Ensemble  
08/04    Road Man
08/11    Anna Coogan & Willie B 
08/18    Richie and Rosie
08/25    Jimkata
09/01    Gunpoets
09/08    TBA (Not currently taking artist inquiries for this date) 
09/15    John Brown's Body

description:
Join us for an unforgettable evening to celebrate and support Planned Parenthood of the Southern Finger Lakes!  Planned Parenthood has been providing critical sexual & reproductive health care, education and family planning services for 100 years- and we want to make sure they are around for 100 more!  

PPSFL and Out for Health has teamed up with The House of Merlot, Alan Extra and Spirit Posse to bring you a night of entertainment, advocacy, education and a whole lot of fun to raise awareness and dollars for PPSFL.  

This event is 21+ only. $5 suggested donation at the door. Expect a night of fabulous live performances, sex trivia, door prizes, raffle, giveaways followed with an epic dance party! 

The House of Merlot is a drag and LGBT+ live performance group that performs every second and fourth Thursday at The Range. This is their first benefit of the year and we cannot wait to continue our tradition of celebrating progressive causes like the ones here tonight. Please tip your performers generously, but don't forget to donate!

Check out the list of incredible performers! Stay tuned to learn more:
House Mother: Athena Merlot
House Mother: Katze Von Riesling
Dragon Phoenix
Ben A. Drill
Ruby Dagger
Alisha Day
Misty Mars
Introducing: Lillia Farris and Dizzy!
Special Guests: Cassanova the King and Family
Featuring: Alan Xtra and the Hit Singles

description:
Downtown Ithaca’s Fourth Annual Ithaca Oktoberfest

Saturday, October 24th from 12:00 - 5:00pm on the Commons

Hosted by the Downtown Ithaca Alliance, Oktoberfest is a celebration of fall in the German Tradition with lots of Beer, Wine, and German Food Tastings! Sample Finger Lakes wines and beers as well as tasty german fare from local restaurants and food vendors!  The Ithaca Oktoberfest is full of rich harvest season celebrations complete with live music.

Purchase tickets and sample as you go.  Drink & Food samples.  Full FOOD menu items also available for purchase.

Like last year, we'll be awarding the Oktoberfest Cup to the most popular beers sampled at the fest.

description:
Santa Claus is coming…to downtown Ithaca! Santa will rappel from the roof of Center Ithaca on to the Commons at Noon on Saturday, December 5! Afterwards, there will be photos with Santa (bring your own camera), crafts, music, and snacks inside Center Ithaca.

Santa’s Arrival is Free and Open to the Public!



Chanukah Details: 
The holiday of Chanukah begins Sunday evening December 6 and concludes in Monday December 14. 
There will be daily lighting of the large 9ft menorah in the small atrium at Center Ithaca. 
Here's the schedule for the daily lighting of the menorah:

Sunday, December 6- Thursday, December 10 lighting will be at 4:30 pm Friday, December 11 at 3 pm No lighting on Saturday night. 
Sunday, December 13, the last night of Chanukah, there will be a wonderful Chanukah celebration at the small atrium with donuts, latkes, music, magic show and lots of entertainment for young and old. The celebration will begin at 4:30 pm. 
Looking forward to some great celebrations. 
The events are sponsored by the Chabad Center with cosponsorship by the Ithaca Area United Jewish Communities

description:
Happening during First Friday Gallery Night, Fashion Night Ithaca!

Let Downtown Ithaca be your style guide to dressing chic as the weather warms.

Journey from one store to the next and enjoy all sorts of fashionable experiences from mini-makeovers, fashion tips from style experts, samples, trunk shows, style contests, live music, food and drinks, prizes, and plenty more!

Pick up a Fashion Night Passport along the way and mark off all your stops in the evening, then enter to win an ultimate Downtown Ithaca Style makeover!

Stores to visit: 
American Crafts by Robbie Dein - Discover delightful and whimsical handcrafted jewelry, scarves, and accessories to update your look for the Summer.

Amuse: Modern Cottage Industry - Showcasing the naturally beautiful creations of Sunny Ridge Designs just added to the shop!  The makers of Sunny Ridge create lovely earrings from #Turquoise, Fresh Water Pearls, Rose Quartz, and #Amethyst.  These natural elements compliment a range of outfits and color palettes at an affordable price!

Benjamin Peters - Gentleman, don't clip, they tie.  Stop in for bow-tie clinics all evening long and receive 20% off any stylish bow-ties purchased that night.  Stop by too for a very special performance at 6PM by Ithaca College's Ithacappella

Body Gear - studio, street, stage - Let Circus Culture performers will impress and inspire you with bright bold colorful cosutmes and performances out front of BodyGear during Fashion Night.  6:30-7:15pm. Check out the latest street, dance, and yoga apparel and gear for the season.  

Breathe - Pop into Breathe for expert style opinion and In-store  makeovers featuring Mary Kay Cosmetics.  Check out great festival-perfect brands including Freepeople and Lucky Brand and local brand FLAX!

Cat's Pajamas - Fanciful face painting for all ages.  Free and all evening during Fashion Night!

Circus Culture - As Fashion Night wraps up for the night "Circus Folk" kicks off at 8pm.  Check out their latest performance of circus talent put to live folk music performed by community favorites Nate Marshall and Travis Knapp!  Tickets available here: http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2542772

FibersIthaca - Discover beautiful colors and prints for the season during Fibers' informal fashion show going on all evening.  Enjoy 20% off all items in the store during Fashion Night.  Also enjoy classical music by the Heifitz Group Suzuki method violinists performing outfront of Fibers from 4:45 - 5:30pm.

Handwork, Ithaca's Artisan Cooperative - As shown in Elizabeth Andrew's latest etchings and paintings, adornment equals transformation. In her "Moth-ers" series, mysterious women are shrouded in moth wings, transformed into "The illuminated spirits of night Lepidoptera".  Join us for Fashion Night and enjoy Elizabeth's latest work, discover  and learn about handmade fashion accessories by Handwork members and try delicious samplings from Bellwether Hard Cider. 

Ithacamade - DIY Silk Screening.  Silk Oak founder, Jan Norman will be there to demonstrate the craft she employs to create the Silk Oak fashion line of clothes sold at Ithacamade and the Ithaca Farmers Market.  Stop in during Fashion Night to make your own silk screened piece of apparel or print.

Narrative Space - Barbershop ad Accessories store, Narrative Space features handmade and American made fashion featuring well-known bespoke brands like Woolrich, Pendleton, Red Wing and more.  Enjoy craft beer samples from Bacchus Brewing Company and tasty bites from Crossroads Bar & Grille.  Guys take note, their barbserhop offers traditional straight blade shaves.  Get some tips on manscaping trends while you're there.

Urban Outfitters - College Night from 3-7PM.  DJ Armen Live, Complimentary drinks, snacks by Pop! Gourmet.  10% off full-price merchandise and an additional 30% off sale merchandise.

One World Market - Not sure how to wear a scarf or sarong this season?  Stop in at One World Market for scarf tying demonstrations and stylish ways to wear them this summer.  Also update your summer look with great jewelry, and handbags too.  Enjoy a discount on Fashion Night purchases too.  One World Market carries a selection of handcrafted products that reflect and reinforce rich cultural traditions that are environmentally sustainable, fair trade, and that appeal to the customer. 

Petrune - Vintage & Modern Style Night! Come have your picture taken by renowned fashion photographer, Maureen Jordan from The Velvet Big Top.  Dress up in your favorite vintage dress, or try  on a new outfit, pose with your friends, enjoy refreshments,  and fun.  Photos will be available to download on the Internet for free, and high quality images can be purchased from The Velvet Big Top.

Thrive NY - "Best Outfit" Contest.  Stop by Thrive and get your photo on their red carpet by in-house Thrive photographer.  Thrive will post all photos on their facebook page.  Tag yourself or vote for your favorit style.  Person in photo with the most likes will receive a Thrive gift card!

description:
The 2016 Summer Concert Series presented by CFCU Community Credit Union kicks off on the Bernie Milton Pavilion stage in the Ithaca Commons on Thursday, June 23! The Summer Concert Series is a free outdoor concert series open to the public held every Thursday evening from June 23 - September 15 (with the exception of Grassroots week- the show will be on Wednesday, July 20 not Thursday). Local and national acts perform music in genres including jazz, blues, reggae, folk, hip hop, country, bluegrass, rock, and more! 

Enjoy a beer and wine garden open for the duration of each concert. Seating is not provided but participants are encouraged to bring a chair and stay a while! The Downtown Ithaca Summer Concert Series has become a weekly summer tradition in the local community; Ithacans and tourists alike enjoy happening upon a vibrant downtown on a weekday evening. 


The CFCU Community Credit Union (CFCU) returns as title sponsor of the award-winning CFCU Summer Concert Series and will be continuing their support of the United Way of Tompkins County through a fundraiser with exciting prizes. Concertgoers can buy a reusable cup, with 100 percent of the proceeds going to the United Way, and be entered to win a private performance by the Gunpoets and other cool perks. This year, the series is also supported by Seneca Beverage Corporation, Ithaca Marriott Downtown on the Commons, Green Street Pharmacy, Six Mile Creek Vineyard, GreenStar Natural Foods Market, The Ithaca Journal, Legacy Foundation of Tompkins County, and the J. M. McDonald Foundation. 
 
For more information about the CFCU Summer Concert Series and other summer events in downtown Ithaca, please visit www.downtownithaca.com.
 
2016 CFCU Summer Concert Series Schedule 
Thursdays* 6-8pm
 
06/23    Stone Cold Miracle
06/30    Casey Max and The Dixie Kats
07/07    Caribe Jazz All Stars               
07/14    Kings of The Fall 
07/20*    (Wednesday Show) Ithaca Underground: Sammus with ¡ Viva Mayhem! (opening)

08/04    Road Man

08/18    Richie and Rosie
08/25    Jimkata
09/01    Gunpoets
09/08    TBA (Not currently taking artist inquiries for this date) 
09/15    John Brown's Body

description:
Kilpatrick’s Publick House will be throwing the first ITHACA VS. FOOD 4 Pound Cast Iron Sheppard's Pie eating contest. Date is set for Saturday, October 1st from 3-6pm on the stage in the Pub. I know for a fact there are plenty of you that could do it and hold the record! We have the BEST company's sponsoring this event including - Maines Foods, Maines Source, WyckWyre (Hiring Solutions and Recruitment), WBVR, Hilton Garden Inn Ithaca, Ithaca to Go and more........ More details to follow and you can register by coming in to sign up @ Kilpatrick’s Monday through Friday 11:30-5 pm. Do not miss out on a spot to win BIG TIME PRIZES!!!!!


Contract and Rules


KILPATRICK’S PUBLICK HOUSE
1st Sheppard’s Pie Eating Competition 




KILPATRICK’S PUBLICK HOUSE
1st Sheppard’s Pie Eating Competition 
$10 DUE UPON SIGNING 


Eating competitions are inherently dangerous activities, and all participants expressly and voluntarily assume the risk of any and all injury and damage that may result from the participation in eating competitions. Participants understand that such risks include, but are not limited to possible bodily injury, partial or total disability, paralysis, death or other injuries or damages. Selection of participation in the event and the risks of loss, damage or injury shall at all times remain with and be borne by each participant. Participants will be required to execute a Waiver of Liability, Release, Assumption of Risk and Indemnity Agreement before participation. 

Official Rules
1.    The Sheppard’s Pie eating competition is open to all amateur eaters 18 years or older who are in good health. Professional eaters, persons recognized by the AICE, the IFOCE or members of any professional eating organization are not eligible. 
2.    Any competitor with a serious ailment or health problem may not compete in the contest.
3.    Competitors may eat sitting down or standing up in there designated areas. Any contestant who leaves their designated area during the contest will be disqualified.
4.    Competitors may not make physical contact with any other competitor at any time. Any competitor who deliberately makes contact with another competitor will be disqualified. 
5.    If a competitor vomits or regurgitates at any time during the competition or during the time period he or she will be disqualified.
6.    If contingencies or disputes arise before, during or after the contest that is not explicitly covered by these official rules, the Executive Judge’s decision will stand with the same finality as the rules.
ALL EATERS MUST REMAIN AT THEIR TABLE UNTIL THE END 

The Contest
1.    Each competitor will start with exactly 4 pounds of our Sheppard's Pie. 
2.    The contest will last exactly (40) minutes. Start time is 3:30 and will finish at 4:10pm.
3.    Once the contest starts, the competitors will consume their allotted Sheppard's Pie 
4.    If a competitor finishes their allotted 4 pounds of Sheppard’s Pie before the contest is over they win.
5.    Once the contest is complete, each competitor’s skillets will be taken to be weighed  by the Executive Judge.
6.    The winner will be determined by the total number of pounds eaten by the Executive Judge. 
7.    In the event of a tie between competitors, there will be a 60 second “run off” to determine the winner. 

“God Speed”

$10 to enter payable @ Kilpatrick's Publick House 130 East Seneca ST Ithaca NY 14850

There will be only one winner and thats the person who finishes first!!!

Grand Prize

A night at The Hilton Garden Inn

$$$ Maines Food Source Store

$50 Kilpatrick's Gift Card

$50 Ithaca To Go 

Kilpatrick's Hat & Tee

Brew City inflatable Race Chair

Picture on our wall of fame

Bragging rights till the next ITHACA VS. FOOD

and more.............

THERE WILL BE ONLY ONE WINNER AND THATS WHO GETS IT DOWN FIRST!!!!

We will have Hand Outs, Great Drink Specials, WVBR on site and Wykewire on site.... Its more than ITHACA VS. FOOD!! It's a ITHACA PARTY at Kilpatrick's Publick Hous

description:
Say NO to cyber shopping and YES to Cider Monday!  Let Downtown Ithaca make your season bright by warming you up with holiday spirit and cheer on Monday, November 28th!  

Local businesses downtown will be welcoming in shoppers with complimentary cups of cider while they shop, and we've got some great Finger Lakes cideries hosting tastings downtown too.
Sample delicious local ciders - which make unqiue and delicious holiday housewarming gifts and do some holiday shopping for loved ones on your list.  Shop Local.  Shop Small. Shop Downtown Ithaca

Cider Monday activities happening around your downtown:

- Bellwether Hard Cider tasting in front of Ithacamade in Dewitt Mall: 4-6pm

- Black Diamond Cider tasting in Press Bay Alley: 4-6pm

- Enjoy complimentary cider tastings by Grisamore Cider Works inside 15 STEPS today from 4-6pm.

- Complimentary warm cider inside Downtown Visitor Center: 12:00-5pm.

- Enjoy complimentary cups of cold cider through a cold-stone dispenser American Crafts by Robbie Dein throughout the day.

 - Sample 4 kind of Black Diamond Cider in addition to the 2 already on tap inside Moosewood Restaurant from 4-7pm.  Enjoy a selection of small bites made to pair perfectly with these ciders too!

- Sample Finger Lakes Cider House's Good Life Cider at Dewitt Mall's GreenStar Natural Foods Market: 4-6pm. Meet Melissa, co-owner of the Finger Lakes Cider House and Good Life Farm and Cider, will be there with Good Life Ciders for you to sample. Stop by for a taste and some informative cider talk!

Downtown Collegetown Bagels will be hosting a Red Jacket Cider Tasting 4-6pm on "Cider Monday" (Monday Nov 28th).  Shoppers can earn extra discounts on warm beverages if they show shopping receipts from downtown Ithaca shop purchases made on Cider Monday!

- enjoy a free candy sample at Life's So Sweet Chocolates in Press Bay Alley

- Enjoy complimentary cider while you shop today inside Sunny Days of Ithaca

name: Cider Monday (not Cyber Monday)

description:
Get Tickets early to avoid the lines at the event!
EVENT TICKETS ON SALE - FEB. 1ST
@  The Downtown Visitors Center, Collegetown Bagels (Collegetown, East Hill and Downtown), and the Downtown Ithaca Alliance (DIA) office located in Center Ithaca.

The 17th Annual Great Downtown Ithaca Chili Cook-off will take place Saturday, February 7th (Raindate Feb. 8th), from 11:30am-4:00pm. Chili Cook-off features chili prepared by approximately 30 restaurants as they compete for the titles of Best Meat/Overall Chili, Best Vegetarian, and People's Choice Chili. In addition to Chili,there are tons of chili activities to participate in!  

The Chili Cook-off will feature a farmers market with vendors and local wineries, breweries, and farmer's sampling their goods. All activities will take place on the Ithaca Commons and surrounding streets.  

 ****** The V.I.P. pass allows the patron access to a separate fast moving V.I.P. line.  Two types of ticket for two wonderful ways to spend the day outside sampling Ithaca's finest grub, local microbrews, wine, farm goods and more . . .one ticket per taste.

For more information visit http://www.downtownithaca.com/ithaca-events/The%20Great%20Downtown%20Ithaca%20Chili%20Cook-off

description:
Have you ever wondered what it would be like to live Downtown? Tour up to 6 Downtown Apartments at the Downtown Living Tour – an Open House of urban living on October 22 from 12noon to 5pm. 

The Downtown Living Tour is a self guided tour of apartments and attractions in the downtown area. It's free and Open to the Public. Register and you’ll receive a lanyard pass, map, coupons and discounts to downtown attractions, and also be entered to win prizes including a $100 Downtown Gift Card. 

Apartments include: 
Gateway Commons
Cayuga Green Apartments
Dewitt Mall
Commons West
Wanzer Building
& Center Ithaca 

You can register in advance by emailing info@downtownithaca.com or calling 607-277-8679. Register on the day at the Downtown Visitors & Ticket Center at Center Ithaca starting at 11:30am. 



For more information contact the Downtown Ithaca Alliance at 277-8679.

venue.about: The Downtown Ithaca Alliance welcomes you to Downtown Ithaca where you can shop, dine, work, and play. It's yours to discover!
venue.name: Downtown Ithaca

name: Downtown Living Tour (Open House)

description:
Ithaca Brunch Fest is a brand new Downtown Ithaca festival happening November 5th! Come join us on the Commons to discover the latest brunch offerings from your favorite restaurants where vendors will have $2 and $5 bites or full meals to choose from! You won't want to miss this delicious day in Downtown Ithaca!

Come on down and break bread, discover new menus and the latest offerings from local businesses. 

Bloody Mary Mix-Off! - Who makes the best Bloody Mary?!
Wagner Vineyards Brunch Bar! - Mimosas, Beer, Floats, and more! 
Live Music! 
Live Screenprinting from Muckles' Ink.! 
Make sure to get a bag of Gimme! Coffee Limited Edition 'Downtown Ithaca' Blend!  

Simeons Ithaca will be serving a tasty sampling of soft dough biscuits covered with creamy gravy while Waffle Frolic will offer its signature dish: Waffles with a selection of toppings. OmNomNomelettes will have a variety of freshly prepared omelettes, french toast, and hot breakfast sandwiches and Kilpatrick's Publick House is putting an Irish spin on its brunch offerings. Bandwagon Pub, Farm and Brewery, Farm and Brewery will be putting a modern take on brunch and Gateway Kitchen will be serving barbecue food items like pulled pork omelettes and mini egg and brisket bagels!  

The fun doesn't end with sampling the multiple food choices.  Attendees will have the opportunity to taste and vote in our first ever Bloody Mary Mix-Off! By purchasing non-alcoholic Bloody Mary samples prepared by Coltivare, Gateway Kitchen, Sunset Grill, Taste of Thai, and more, folks will discover who has the best Bloody Mary in town. These establishments will be going head-to-head, vying for your votes for Best Presentation and People's Choice. 

Additional beverage options will be available at the Brunch Bar. Sponsored by Wagner Valley Brewing Co. and Vineyards, the Brunch Bar will feature some of the company's finest brews.

Among these beverage offerings will be a fruity Hop Tropic IPA accompanied by a logo that features stunning artwork from Ithaca street artist, Jay Stooks; Smoketober will be used for a Bloody Mary inspired beverage, and a new Coffee Porter made with freshly brewed espresso and served with whipped cream topping. 

A special edition Mangose, which can be served on its own but pairs nicely with orange sherbet to create a fun beer float, will be available along with a selection of wine, including a sparkling riesling for mimosas and a red hot mulled wine. There will be non-alcoholic options, too. 

Tune Schedule: 
11:30-12:15pm IC Voicestream & Premium Blend
12:30-1:15 Fall Creek Brass Band
1:30-2:30- Steve Southworth and the Rockabilly Rays
2:45-4pm - Town Squares (Luke G, Tenor, & Joe doing doo-wop & oldies with a punk twist)

description: Hailing from Ovid, Cap Cooke and Cady Fontana play old time music featuring the heartfelt vocals of Cady Fontana. Add Cap's style of banjo and you're left with a clean, honest sound with a mountain flair. Drawing from influences such as Ola Belle Reed, Gillian Welch, and John Hartford, Cap and Cady are sure to make you smile.
name: Cap and Cady: Free Live Music Wednesday

description:
Presented by the Downtown Ithaca Alliance

Dress up in costume and join in the fun!
The parade will start from the Greater Ithaca Activities Center(GIAC) at 3:45pm and makes its way onto the Ithaca Commons. 

Tick-or-Treating and Halloween festivities will run 4:00 - 6:00PM. Stores participating in the festivities will have a "Trick-or-Treat" sign prominently displayed in their storefront window indicating that the store is greeting trick-or-treaters. Store participating are located on the Commons, Aurora Street, Cayuga Street and inside DeWitt Mall.

Enjoy music, mini-carnival games, hot apple cider, and chili inside Center Ithaca from 4:00 - 6:00PM. 

Schedule
3:45 pm – 
                 Community Halloween Parade.  
                 Starting point: GIAC 
                 End point: Ithaca Commons
4:00 - 6:00  pm –    
                 Downtown Ithaca Trick-or-Treating
                 Areas include: Ithaca Commons, DeWitt Mall, Cayuga  
                 Street, Aurora  Street
4:00 - 6:00  pm – 
                 Center Ithaca Halloween Festivities
                 Mini Carnival games
                 Chili & Hot Apple Cider
                 Music

More information: (607) 277-8679 or downtownithaca.com

venue.name: Downtown Ithaca

name: Halloween Parade & Trick-or-Treating in Downtown Ithaca

description:
Check out what's going on for Halloween in Downtown Ithaca!

October 28, 4:00pm-7:00pm, join the annual Halloween parade, starting at GIAC (301 West Court St.) and continuing through downtown and the Commons. Kids will trick or treat at participating merchants downtown! Trick or treating continues from October 29-31, just look for the pumpkins at participating merchants. 

Visit our spooky Haunted House at the Commons West Building, 101 E. State St. The Haunted House will be free and geared for children from 4-6:30pm. From 7-9pm it will take a turn for the spookier, so adults can join in the fun and there will be a $3.00 suggested donation. All funds will go towards the Youth Employment Service of the Ithaca Youth Bureau. The Haunted House will also be open Saturday, October 29 from 6-9pm. 

From 7:00-8:00pm there will be a special Halloween performance by Shark Pony (indie pop with a punk edge!) at the Bernie Milton Pavilion on the Commons so stop by and dance!

Zombies are encouraged to join the Ithaca Zombie pub lurch, which starts at 8 pm at the Chapter House in Collegetown. Other meeting spots by the hour are the Commons near Madeline’s at 9 pm, Commons near Evolution at 10pm and Felicia’s/Westy at 11pm. Must be 21 or over. 

From 10:00pm-1:00am, Z95.5 will also be hosting a zombie and costume party at 2nd floor bar. There will be Halloween drink specials, costume contests and other festive fun. Must be 21 or over.

venue.about: The Downtown Ithaca Alliance welcomes you to Downtown Ithaca where you can shop, dine, work, and play. It's yours to discover!
venue.name: Downtown Ithaca

name: Halloween Downtown Ithaca

description:
Head to Rulloff's this Thursday find out a little more about craft brewing from Troegs. You can get creative with some adult coloring or just taste and learn.

Troges is famous in this area for their Nugget Nectar of the Gods! "It’s impossible to forget your first squeeze. Once a year, as the newest humulus lupulus harvest arrives at Tröegs, we blend these super-fresh hops into an Imperial Amber Ale. Excessively dry-hopped, Nugget Nectar is an explosion of pine, resin and mango." 

Learn about more tasty brews and try a few . . .

Upcoming Beer Series Tastes: https://www.facebook.com/rulloffs/events
name: Troegs Beer Tasting @Rulloffs

description:
Downtown Ithaca is Encouraging Shopping Local on Saturday, November 28th and throughout the Holiday Season.

WHY SHOP LOCAL? Small Business Saturday was started by American Express four years ago so that small business could have its day. Big retailers have Black Friday and online retailers have Cyber Monday, so Small Business Saturday is a way to educate consumers about shopping locally and to have an impact on the small business bottom line, kick starting the holiday season. (from Shopsmall.com)
Downtown Ithaca has over 100 independent, locally owned stores and businesses to choose from. By shopping or dining locally on Saturday, November 29th and for the holidays, patrons can show their support for local businesses and for our community.
When money is spent at independent locally owned business the money stays here. Local businesses donate more, and the owners and managers live and pay taxes here, strengthening the economic base of where we live. Plus the one-of-a-kind businesses contribute to the character of our community with unique shopping and dining options.
For more information visit shopsmall.com, contact the DIA at 607-277-8679, or email us at info@downtownithaca.com

description:
Tompkins County Festivals Program Presents:

2017 FREE Event Planning Workshops
Wednesday, March 1, 2017  & Wednesday, March 22, 2017
9:00 - 3:00PM at Cinemapolis Movie Theatre in Downtown Ithaca
 
 
Who should attend?
-          Individuals and groups applying for STPB Room Tax grant funding
-          Any event planners looking to do projects in 2016
-          Groups and organizations interested in considering new events or growing existing ones
-          Any one interested in learning more about event coordinator responsibilities and planning.
 
Workshop Goals:
Provide event planners in Tompkins County with topical, timely, and useful information on various aspects of event planning. Enable event planners to learn new ideas and share information with each other about challenges and solutions in the event planning process.  Help event planners be better prepared and organized for the event they are organizing. Inspire event planners to think about how their events can have a positive tourism impact on the community.
 
2017 Workshop Format:  
 
Wednesday, March 1st
Beginner Workshop Day: 
Tompkins County Festivals Program Presents:
2017 Event Planning Boot Camp
A FREE & Informative Event!
Wednesday, March 1, 2017
at Cinemapolis Theatre
 
WORKSHOP I - Beginner Event Organizers
Wednesday, March 1, 2017
 
8:45AM - 9:00AM   CHECK-IN
Coffee & Tea compliments of Tompkins Festivals Program
 
MORNING MODULE -  9:00AM - 12:00PM
9:00AM - 10:00AM
THE EVENT PLANNING PROCESS
So you are planning to organize an event?  Now what? This general seminar will cover a host of issues that are involved with developing a sound event plan from setting up a budget, fundraising beforehand, creating income generators at an event, insuring your event, and applying for permits with the SLA.
Speakers:
Tatiana Sy - Special Events Director at Downtown Ithaca
 
10:00AM -  11:00AM
TRASH TALKIN’ - DISCUSSION ON EVENT SUSTAINABILITY
Adam will be discussing what to do with the mountain of trash your event generates, ways to reduce your landfill contribution through recycling and composting programs, ways to offset your carbon footprint, and opportunities  to appeal to your audience by cleaning up your act!
Speakers:
Adam Michaelides - Program Manager, Cornell Cooperative Extension Compost Education Program
Jeremy Betterley & Janet Edwards - Ithaca CRT
 
 
11:00AM - 12:00PM
GRANTS, SPONSORS & REVENUE STREAMS
What makes for a good grant? Why should a sponsor fund your event? How does your event make money to fund itself?  This panel discussion will dive into the nuts and bolts of making an event happen...funding.  
Speakers:
Robin Schwartz - Program Director, Community Arts Partnership  | Stephanie Bailey - Event & Program Manager, Tompkins County Chamber of Commerce
 
12:00PM - 1:00PM
LUNCH BREAK
Lunch compliments of Tompkins Festivals Program
 
AFTERNOON MODULE - 1:00-3:00PM
 
1:00PM - 1:30PM
ALCOHOL & THE SLA
Thinking about serving alcohol at your event?  Want to have a beer tent at your festival?  Alcohol is a controlled substance regulated by the State Liquor Authority of New York and serving it at an event requires a lot more careful attention to details and paperwork that you think!  Speaker Tatiana Sy will cover some interesting and relevant concerns all event planner must address when considering serving alcohol at an event.  
Speakers:
Tatiana Sy - Special Events Director, Downtown Ithaca Alliance
 
1:30PM - 2:15PM
EQUIPMENT & PERMITTING 101  
How do you run a generator or put up a pop up tent? What are the state and local requirements for safety plans? What are the basic rules when working with fire and police for your event?  What permits are you applying for and where can you find them?
 
Speakers:
Julie Holcomb - City of Ithaca  | Kathy Servoss - City of Ithaca | Scott Rougeau - Downtown Ithaca Alliance & Tompkins Festivals Equipment Coordinator
 
2:30PM - 3:00PM
Technical Support - OPEN Q+A
Take this time to ask any follow up questions that apply specifically to your event one on one with Tatiana! Please come prepared with any questions as we’ll allot approximately 5min per attendee and schedule follow up meetings if necessary.
Speakers:
Tatiana Sy - Special Events Director at Downtown Ithaca
 
 
RSVP HERE: https://goo.gl/forms/cdy0DP3dSC25UIM63

Downtown Ithaca’s 2nd Annual Ithaca Oktoberfest

Kilpatrick’s Publick House & Downtown Ithaca Alliance to host the Second Annual Ithaca Oktoberfest – October 26 – 2 to 6pm in Downtown Ithaca on Restaurant Row.  The Ithaca Oktoberfest is full of rich harvest season celebrations complete with live music, samplings from regional breweries, wineries and farmers, as well as local food vendors.

Local favorite microbreweries will be competing in the Oktoberfest championship for best beer.  The first Champion of the “Oktobercup”, Cortland Beer Company, will be back to defend the tasty title.  Other competitors include Bandwagon, Empire Brewing, Bacchus Brewing, and Ithaca Beer Company. Local farm goods and food tastings will be available at every turn.

You will be able taste the last bit of fresh seasonal apple cider or get pumpkins to take home and carve.  Ithaca’s authentic sauerkraut makers will be on site to give a real Oktoberfest feel to any tasty treat.   There will be live music such as and Ithaca Oktoberfest is a day devoted to great beer, wine, food, and music! Come celebrate with Ithaca’s finest indie rock band, Monoculture from 2-4pm; a fresh duo of musicians dedicated to the influences of pop, blues and soul. description:
**FXFOWLE Lecture for Sustainability, Urbanism, and Design**

For Anna Heringer (born in 1977), architecture is a tool to improve lives. As an architect and honorary professor of the UNESCO Chair of Earthen Architecture, Building Cultures, and Sustainable Development, she is focusing on the use of natural building materials. She has been actively involved in development cooperation in Bangladesh since 1997. Her diploma work at the Modern Education and Training Institute in Rudrapur, Bangladesh, was completed in 2005 and won the Aga Khan Award for Architecture in 2007. Over the years, Heringer has completed additional projects in Asia, Africa, and Europe. She lectures worldwide and has been a visiting professor at various universities, including Stuttgart, Linz, Vienna, ETH Zürich, and TU Munich. She has received numerous honors, including the renowned Loeb Fellowship at Harvard GSD, the Architectural Review Emerging Architecture Awards in 2006 and 2008, the Global Award for Sustainable Architecture, and a RIBA International Fellowship. Her work was widely published and exhibited at MoMA in New York City, the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, and at the Venice Biennale, among other places. In 2013, with Andres Lepik and Hubert Klumpner, she initiated the Laufen Manifesto, where practitioners and academics from around the world contributed to defining guidelines for a humane design culture.

October 19, 2016, 5:15 p.m., Milstein Auditorium, , Cornell University

MORE: 

Event Webpage: https://aap.cornell.edu/news-events/anna-heringer-architecture-tool-improve-lives

Anna Heringer's Website: http://www.anna-heringer.com/

description:
(Sandoval will also speak on Nov. 17, 4:30 p.m., in 115 W. Sibley Hall)

Gerardo Francisco Sandoval is an associate professor in the Department of Planning, Public Policy, and Management at the University of Oregon. His research focuses on the roles of immigrants in community regeneration, the urban planning interventions of governments in low-income immigrant communities, and the transnational relationships that exists within immigrant neighborhoods. Sandoval's books include Immigrants and the Revitalization of Los Angeles: Development and Change in MacArthur Park, which received honorable mention for ACSP's Paul Davidoff Award, and Biking Justice and Urban Transformations: Biking for All? Sandoval has published in journals focused on urban planning and community development such as the Journal of Planning Education and Research, Urban Studies, Community Development, and the Journal of Urbanism. He received his Ph.D. in city and regional planning from the University of California–Berkeley.

Abstract:

Sandoval examines how four Latino low-income neighborhoods resist gentrification pressures as large-scale, transit-oriented, redevelopment projects threaten these neighborhoods. The study is situated within debates of transportation justice and urban cultural identity politics. The consequent transformation of these transit-oriented development projects to incorporate equity concerns and issues of cultural identity provides avenues for mitigating gentrification concerns in the neighborhoods. The neighborhoods studied are the Fruitvale in Oakland, Boyle Heights and MacArthur Park in Los Angeles, and Logan Heights in San Diego. These in-depth neighborhood case studies contribute to the planning field as planners grapple with conflicts generated via their public transit and "affordable housing" investments in low-income ethnic neighborhoods. The stories and struggles of resistance that emerged from these threatened neighborhoods provide a deeper understanding of contemporary spatial urban change in a new globalized context of translocal migration and changing cultural preferences based on sustainability. 

November 18, 2016, 12:20 p.m.
Abby and Howard Milstein Auditorium, Milstein Hall, Cornell University

Sponsored by the Russell Van Nest Black Lectureship Fund.

More: http://aap.cornell.edu/news-events/gerardo-francisco-sandoval-defending-barrio-gentrification-resistance-and-neighborhood

Holiday, Outerwear, and Daytime looks will be featured in this downtown showcase as part of the Winter Festival events in 2013.  Unique to this show, participating retailers will be offering in-store discounts, prizes, and giveaways for attending the Runway Holiday Fashion Show.  Shop local this holiday season!  

By attending you can gain a glimpse of the newly stocked items available for this holiday season along with vintage accessory pairings, and introduction to sustainable clothing, seasonal trends that are just hitting the runway and the latest in winter wear for the season. description:
**Check out www.restaurantweekithaca.com for participating restaurants and special menus!**
Follow @irestaurantweek on twitter for the latest updates!

As a kick off event for the Ithaca Winter Festival, Ithaca Restaurant week will be held November 30th- December 8th.  This is a wonderful time to try new eateries you have wondered about for years.  Whether you are visiting from out of town, or a local resident of Ithaca, Restaurant Week is a unique experience that showcases a wide range of food options at affordable prices. This winter, chefs will select specials that showcase their signature dishes. Participants will also be hosting special events to highlight bar and restaurant items.  Ithaca is no newcomer to the food world. Ithaca, NY has more restaurants per capita than New York City, and continues to attract diners across the globe. In fact, Ithaca was recognized by Bon Appetit magazine as one of the “foodiest” towns in America.  Ithaca is known for their local farmers and restaurants, providing fresh and healthy options, which attract residents and visitors alike. 

The advantage of dining in Ithaca during Restaurant Week is getting great deals on local cuisine.  For instance, Ciao! Wood-fired Pizza & Pasta is offering pasta and salad lunch specials for only $6.95.  Maxie’s Supper Club and Oyster Bar is offering happy hour specials like half-priced shucked oysters and clams plus $10 off all bottles of wine every night of Restaurant Week.  Hazelnut Kitchen, like many of the participating restaurants, is introducing a three-course prix fixe menu with wine parings that highlight the extraordinary bounty of Tompkins County.  Restaurant Week is not limited to dining out experiences, Collegetown Bagels offers lunch and brunch specials for busy work days or lunches on the go.

In addition to Restaurant Week, events such Ice Wars Ice Carving Competition, Downtown Ithaca’s Annual Chowder Cook-off, and even Santa’s Arrival to Downtown will also be part The Ithaca Winter Festival.  Being one of the top vacation destinations in upstate New York, Ithaca/Tompkins County is the perfect destination to start off the Holiday Season.  Spend a day or a long weekend exploring the city.  Tompkins County has lodging options to accommodate and type of stay form hotels and motels to quaint inns and bed & breakfasts.  Check out the various and unique shops of the surrounding areas where you can find gifts for yourself and loved ones this holiday season.

For full menus and specials of the restaurants participating in Winter Restaurant Week, visit http://www.restaurantweekithaca.com. 

Restaurant-goers from outside of Ithaca can also find more information on things to do in Ithaca at www.downtownithaca.com.

This program was made possible by a grant from the Tompkins County Tourism Program, Maines Paper & Food Service, Inc. and the Downtown Ithaca Alliance.

description:
What is FLUFF?
soft fibers from fabrics like wool or cotton that accumulate in light clumps?
entertainment or objects perceived as superficial or ornamental?
a sweet marshmallow creme product sold by the jar?

Come to Thumbnail FLUFF to hear how a select number of students and professors at Cornell see fluff as a part of their work and interests.The line-up will consist of 10 presentations from a mix of 4 professors, 8 undergraduate students, and 1 MFA student. Based on the model of Pecha Kucha, each presentation is 20 slides x 20 seconds each.

FLUFF will begin at 6:30 pm on April 15th, immediately following an exhibit of student work entitled STUFF in the Milstein Dome, hosted by Cornell University AIAS.

For photos and media from past Thumbnail events, check out Thumbnail. on facebook or http://thumbnailcu.tumblr.com/ !

description:
Sandoval will also speak on Nov. 18, 12:200 p.m., in the Abby and Howard Milstein Auditorium)

 Gerardo Francisco Sandoval is an associate professor in the Department of Planning, Public Policy, and Management at the University of Oregon. His research focuses on the roles of immigrants in community regeneration, the urban planning interventions of governments in low-income immigrant communities, and the transnational relationships that exist within immigrant neighborhoods. Sandoval's books include Immigrants and the Revitalization of Los Angeles: Development and Change in MacArthur Park, which received honorable mention for ACSP's Paul Davidoff Award; and Biking Justice and Urban Transformations: Biking for All? Sandoval has published in journals focused on urban planning and community development such as the Journal of Planning Education and Research, Urban Studies, Community Development, and the Journal of Urbanism. He received his Ph.D. in city and regional planning from the University of California–Berkeley.

Abstract:

Sandoval examines four Latino barrios resisting gentrification pressures as large-scale, transit–oriented redevelopment projects threaten their neighborhoods. This study is situated within debates of transportation justice and urban cultural identity politics. Sandoval argues that contemporary Latino neighborhood anti-gentrification movements are a form of continuity of cultural practices and political resistance to an emerging reorganization of struggles over forms of collective consumption. These social urban movements, influenced by cultural identity, represent a continuation of historical struggles within the Latino barrio to reassert control over their neighborhoods by creating spaces for meaningful participation in the development process and hence encourage opportunities for community investments and benefits. Sandoval situates this argument in a multiple-site case study in California where he examines the role that Latino ethnic community identity plays in unifying these barrios. The barrios include the Fruitvale in Oakland, Boyle Heights and MacArthur Park in Los Angeles, and Barrio Logan in San Diego. The stories of resistance and struggles that emerged from these threatened barrios provide a deeper understanding of the role cultural identity plays in shaping contemporary anti-gentrification social movements. This study demonstrates how barrio residents use Latino cultural identity as a tool for resistance, for political mobilization, and as symbolic territory to create spaces for meaningful participation in the urban planning and development process to sustain their barrios.

Thurs., Nov. 17, 4:30 p.m.
115 W. Sibley Hall, Cornell University

More: https://aap.cornell.edu/news-events/gerardo-francisco-sandoval-protecting-barrio-gentrification-neighborhood-resistance-and

On Saturday December 14th the Fourth Annual Chowder Cook-off is set to take place outside on the 200 N. Aurora Street block of Downtown.  This is often the tastiest part of Winter Festival with twenty Chowders competing for the coveted Chowder Cup from noon until five.

Purchase tasting tickets and then take the tasty journey through downtown to sample all the different types of Chowder. Tickets are $10 for 10 tastings and include vegetarian, seafood, and meat chowders. You may purchase tickets at the event ticket booth or purchase tickets in advance to avoid waiting in line.  Tickets are available December 2nd at the Downtown Visitor's Center or by calling 607-277-8679.  

As a part of Winter Festival in Downtown you will not want to miss the Ithaca Ice Wars while tasting the warm winter chowders. description:
Christine Elfman (B.F.A. '04) explores the constancy of change through photography, painting, and film. By making images out of their own disappearance, Elfman acknowledges the inseparability of permanence and fugitivity within pictorial representation. Her work offers a reminder that the harder one tries to capture an object, the more it evades the grasp.

From the Philadelphia area, Elfman received her B.F.A. in painting from Cornell University and M.F.A. in photography from California College of the Arts. She has worked extensively with early photographic processes and with historic collections at the George Eastman House, University of Rochester Rare Books Library, and the Berkeley Art Museum.  Elfman has been awarded the San Francisco Artist Award, the San Francisco Foundation Murphy and Cadogan Fellowship, the Center for Emerging Visual Artists Career Development Fellowship, and an artist residency at the Saltonstall Foundation. She has taught photography most recently at San Francisco Art Institute and is currently a visiting critic in the Department of Art at AAP. She is represented by Gallery Wendi Norris in San Francisco.

MORE: https://aap.cornell.edu/news-events/christine-elfman-evasive-copy-photography-and-disappearance
